DOC.brief_title: ( A Novel Pharmacologic Regime Elective Percutaneous Coronary Intervention )
DOC.detailed_description: Aim : Primary objective : To evaluate efficiency safety low dose intracoronary unfractioned heparin ( UFH ) elective percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) . Secondary objective : - To evaluate effect low dose intracoronary UFH myocardial ischemia PCI . - To evaluate effect low dose intracoronary UFH bleeding complication PCI . - To evaluate cost-effectivity low dose intracoronary UFH elective PCI Study central : - Bursa Postgraduate Hospital , Cardiology Clinic Study population : - plan enrol 200 patient . - Patients randomise two group ( control group:100 patient , study group:100 patient ) Study work : -Write case report form patient - Control inclusion criterion - Demographic data ( age , gender ) - Height , weight , BMI glomerular filtration rate ( GFR ) - Risk factor - laboratory data ( biochemical hematologic ) - Medication history - Echocardiographic data - Angiographic data - Procedure time - PCI data ( vessel diameter , stent diameter , lesion stent length , perform percutaneous transluminal coronary angioplasty ( PTCA ) , etc ) - Before procedure ( activate clotting time ) ACT value - Before procedure troponin I ( TnI ) Creatine kinase MB ( CKMB ) level - Note complication ( MACE , bleeding , hematoma etc ) - Note femoral compression time . 4 week later note first control data . Six month later note second control data .
DOC.criteria: The patient ; plan elective PCI write informed consent participation study . The native coronary artery ; lesion narrow > =70 % , lesion without thrombus leave main coronary artery ( LMCA ) lesion chronic total occlusion lesion Patients allergy acetylsalicylic acid ( ASA ) , Clopidogrel heparin Patients perform primary PCI Patients acute coronary syndrome Patients history myocardial infarction ( MI ) two week Patients use UFH low molecular weight heparin ( LMWH ) 24 hour Patients warfarin therapy Patients bleed diathesis , high risk bleeding .
